name: Hotel Santa Teresa - Relais & Chateaux

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am baffled why this amazing 5 star hotel is not number 1 on Tripadvisor. I can only assume it’s because it’s open just over 2 years and as a result has fewer reviews. Having also stayed in the top rated hotel in Rio (Copacabana Palace) I feel I am well placed to make a judgement on which of the 2 I would regard as the best hotel. Without doubt, the Hotel Santa Teresa is superior in every way, from décor to food and service, there is no comparison.
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing

reviews.text: The hotel is located in the charming suburb of Santa Teresa. It is an old coffee plantation house which has been refurbished to the highest standards. The décor is beautiful and modern yet they managed to retain a lot of its original features adding to its character and charm. The grounds of the hotel are exquisite with lush, tropical gardens and a winding stone path leading down to the pool area which overlooks the city of Rio. The bar has a Moroccan feel to it, decorated in warm yellows and reds with an open area containing sofas and bed type loungers to relax while having a drink. Along with drinks, we ordered some food in the bar which was very tasty. The staff in the hotel were incredible, very professional yet friendly and extremely helpful, Aymeric in particular stands out for his exceptional customer service.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our bedroom was tastefully decorated, a lot of wooden features which gave a feel of the old plantation house. It was very spacious and a lovely room to relax in. The hotel is under the flight path of the airport which sometimes can be noisy, however, there wasn’t any air traffic after 10 in the evening so it doesn’t disrupt your sleep.
reviews.title: OK but do not believe the hype

reviews.text: We ate in the hotel’s restaurant which was a very enjoyable dining experience. The service was fantastic and the food was divine, we could not fault a thing. The chef, Damian, was eager to meet with guests to ensure everyone was enjoying their evening.
reviews.title: Gorgeous

reviews.text: The breakfast wasn’t quiet what we expected! It was a bowl of fruit and a type of bread/cake which tasted like ginger cake! Don’t get me wrong, it was fine but not what we were expecting for our breakfast!
reviews.title: Good, but not perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights at Santa Teresa, and very much enjoyed our stay there. The building and decoration are nice and sophisticated without falling into the design cliches of the boutique hotel, our room was spacious with a very nice view of town, and staff at the reception was helpful and welcoming.
reviews.title: An enjoyable, alternative experience of Rio

reviews.text: Those who think of Rio as mainly Copacabana or Ipanema will be a bit disappointed. Although close the Centro, the hotel is somewhat remote from the mythic beaches of Rio (15-20 mn by taxi), which we knew before going there. The Santa Teresa neighborhood is however a charming, genuine part of town which offers a very different and refreshing view of Rio, complementary to the modern, busy and fashionable environment of Copacabana/Ipanema.
reviews.title: Classy, Elegant and Refined

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are spacious, clean, nicely decorated, and some of them have a wonderful view of town, but you feel sometimes more at a (large) friend's house than in a luxury palace, which also has its charms. For instance, when we got in, the door handle of the loo was broken, there wasn't any plug in the bath and noise insulation isn't always to the most modern standards. Nothing that put us off, but something to bear in mind if what you are looking for is impeccable comfort
reviews.title: A pleasant stay in the heart of Rio, but a little far from the action.

reviews.text: There is a nice swimming pool overlooking the charming Santa Teresa neighborhood, a good Spa, but unfortunately no gym. The restaurant is considered as being among the best in Rio, and is indeed offering very good food.
reviews.title: Beautiful boutique hotel but not close to Rio's beaches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service can be frustratingly slow at the restaurant or the bar, which is not necessarily specific to this hotel, we experienced that in other upscale places in Brazil.
reviews.title: Be aware - these are amateurs!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I spent 4 nights at this hotel at the end of November before heading to Iguassu. We decided on this hotel after the positive communication & input I had received from the staff over e-mail. Our other choices that we passed over were the Copacabana & the Fasano. We were glad to have taken a chance on the hotel as we loved the Santa Teresa area. While we would have to take a cab to the beaches and other attractions, we could return to the tranquility of Santa Teresa and it's little shops and restaurants. The hotel arranged airport transfers and other reservations efficiently and the feel of the 40 room hotel was intimate & relaxing. We felt like we had moved into a neighborhood for a couple days.
reviews.title: Perfect Cozy Home Away From Home in Rio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, wonderful staff and the best bed in the world!

reviews.text: - Staff are excellent at meeting your needs (especially the front desk)
reviews.title: Disapointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - excellent bar with relaxing day beds looking over the city lights
reviews.title: Do not judge a book by it's cover
Just visited and had lunch but looked lovely
reviews.text: - dinner at the in house restaurant Terezé was excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Santa Teresa was a choice between staying up in the hills above the city, or picking a spot amongst the usual beaches most tourists end up at.
reviews.title: The best hotel in Rio??

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The drive to the hotel (hotel transfer, see below) was a bit worrying, as the driver brought us up some still pretty run-down back streets (Santa Teresa was apparently pretty dodgy 4 or 5 years back), but once through the gates you can quickly see why this place has the plaudits it has. Versus the main beaches, Santa Teresa the village has a feeling of a little haven up above the craziness of the city centre. The character of the village is a huge plus-side of the stay and the Hotel Santa Teresa appears to be by far the best accomodation choice in the area.
reviews.title: Boutiquey, but too far from hip areas of Ipanema and Leblon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gardens aren't big, but are well maintained and have great views over Santa Teresa, back down to the Centro (CBD) and of the bay itself. The hotel lobby is incredibly spacious and full of beautiful furniture and art.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel in the coolest neighborhood!

reviews.text: Our original room was very nice, but located at the the back of the hotel with pretty average views. We asked if it was possible to move and got immediately switched to a room on the front of the hotel, overlooking the pool and Rio bay. A definite tip is to request a pool facing room when you book!
reviews.title: Absolutely Gorgeous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was large, with a fantastic bed and with a continued use of beautifully restored woods for the exceptional furniture and fittings. Maintenance wise, one of the lights was out, a door handle fell off in my hand and one of the shower taps did the same, but while this may seem inexcusable for such a pricey place to some, none of it really bothered us and we know, had we asked, it would've been quickly fixed up.
reviews.title: Can we move in?

aka: Hotel Santa Teresa - Relais And Chateaux
description: The Hotel Santa Teresa, new 5 star boutique hotel spa and the only Relais & Chateaux of the city, is a former colonial ranch located in the heart of the historic district of Rio de Janeiro. The Hotel features the best views of the city, the harbor and the famous bay of Rio. Decoration tropical ethic design was inspired by the African Indigenous roots of the North and East of Brazil, by the great times of coffee and sugarcane. The burnt cement, the lime stones, the golden slates, the tropical woods and the banana tree fibers are being mixed with the contemporary design of artists Sergio Rodrigues, Zemog or Oficina de Agosto. In the hotel's tropical gardens, the 25-meter long polish green slate swimming pool offers unique panoramic views over Rio de Janeiro. With a natural yet luxurious and unique environment, the Spa features beauty and corporal relaxation treatments of the Amazonian brand of Natura. For the gastronomes, the restaurant Térèze, with an industrial wood, linen and steel design is frequented by the high society of Cariocas and offers the best of French cuisine with a Brazilian flair, created by our Chef Damien Montecer. Hotel is close to all attractions such as Christ redeemer Corcovado, Lapa Nightlife, Sugar Loaf, historic center, museums and famous beach of Copacabana. Not to be missed!
